result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arionel Peguero Vargas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Arionel Peguero Vargas appeared by video.  Attorney Corey Mehlos appeared by video for Arionel Peguero Vargas.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant needs to schedule a TAD evaluation and counsel requests a DPA hearing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/7/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Arionel Peguero Vargas in court.  Attorney Corey Mehlos in court for Arionel Peguero Vargas.  Student Intern Abigail Doweiko under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Tom Potter who is available by phone.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  All Mendards located in Milwaukee County

Attorney Corey Mehlos in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant does not appear. Defense counsel offers explaination for defendant's non-appearance. 
Defense counsel requests a new date for reasons stated on the record. State does not object. 
Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in OCCR.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Commissioner Riepenhoff granted Attorney Mehlos to change the court date from 7/29/2022 to 8/16/2022 at 2:30 p.m.
Initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Request from Atty requesting an adjournment for personal reason.  The matter is adjourned and rescheduled for the requested date of 7/29/2022 at 2:30pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 061634,
Payable Number: 1017763,
Receipt Number: 22RP027174,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 2:30p
